thread.title: BOYS SOCCER DISTRICT PREVIEW: Durand, Perry clash again in first round of districts
thread.title_full: BOYS SOCCER DISTRICT PREVIEW: Durand, Perry clash again in first round of districts

author: CHRIS HAULER Argus-Press Sports Writer
title: BOYS SOCCER DISTRICT PREVIEW: Durand, Perry clash again in first round of districts
text:
Argus-Press Photo/Stephen Brooks Mike Van Buren 
Perry senior forward Mike Van Buren tries to maintain possession while engaged with a Leslie defender during the Ramblers’ Aug. 28 home game. Van Buren is putting together a breakout senior season that already includes an area-best goal total. Argus-Press Photo/Chris Hauler Hunter Robbins, Tyler Deese 
DURAND’S HUNTER ROBBINS (15) races for possession of the ball as Corunna’s Tyler Deese, right, tries to cut off Robbins Thursday in the first half at Durand High School. Argus-Press Photo/Jerome Murphy Kieran Smith, Drew Rupert, Colton Rickman 
OWOSSO’S KIERAN SMITH (10) fights for the ball against Corunna’s Drew Rupert (20) and Colton Rickman (15) in the first half Wednesday at Corunna. Owosso topped Corunna 4-3. Argus-Press Photo/Jerome Murphy Perry vs. Ovid-Elsie 
Perry's Buddy Douglas, left, and Ovid-Elsie’s Joey McGroarty (17) collide while fighting for possession of the ball during the second half of Saturday’s fifth-place game at the Argus-Press Varsity Soccer Invitational in Owosso. Argus-Press Photo/Stephen Brooks Holden Carter 
Byron forward Holden Carter, left, holds off a Durand defender during Tuesday’s game at Durand High School. The Eagles fell, 8-0. Argus-Press Photo/Jerome Murphy Jacob Speiss, Ryan Kingsbury 
PERRY’S JACOB SPIESS (3) controls the ball as Laingsburg’s Lucas Kibzey, left, and Ryan Kingsbury, right, look on Monday at Laingsburg. The Wolfpack defeated the Ramblers 3-1. Posted: Monday, October 19, 2015 11:00 am BOYS SOCCER DISTRICT PREVIEW: Durand, Perry clash again in first round of districts By CHRIS HAULER Argus-Press Sports Writer The Argus-Press | 0 comments 
DURAND — Durand coach Floyd Lincoln was irritated with his team’s effort after the Railroaders gutted out an ugly 3-1 win over Chesaning on Oct. 12. 
Afterward, Lincoln questioned whether Durand’s eight-game win streak was getting to his players’ heads.
